intro: Indigofera sulcata, commonly known as the African indigo or sour fig, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, edible pods that contain a single seed, and it is often used in traditional medicine. Indigofera sulcata is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it useful in agricultural settings.
